line.comment: * DO NOT USE ARRAYS AS RETURN VALUES. USE TABLES INSTEAD.
* NOTE: [DATATYPE_TABLE] is not recognized by X-Studio. Use "if table get size: table = $return" instead.
* !ship.cmd.fleet.supply automatically checks if the supplier is needed by at least one fleet, so we don't need to check that here.

line.text: 'The supplier cannot be in a fleet'

line.comment: * ZH 2.0 - selecting a basic ship type without a template is now possible

line.text: 'All ships are joining the fleet commander.'
'Click on a follower to switch its current fleet status.'

line.comment: * Mordan4. Remove lag by stripping colors. This submenu is already being colored below when added to the menu, so if we have colors to start with, the system chokes on it a bit.

line.text: 'You have no fleet commander. To promote any ship, see Ship Command Console > Fleet Control.'
'Fleet: Dock at commander's homebase (no homebase set)'
'(blocks Porte de scan, sector monitoring, repair and inspections)'
'Followers only. Engage enemy ships in range. 0km to disable.'
'only recommended if all fleet ships have similar speed (fast ships rush ahead).'
'Attack order: 1/ Priority target 2/ Porte de scan 3/ Commander's attacker 4/ Commander's target (optional).'
'Followers always engage station targets regardless of this setting.'
'Followers get sent to nearest safe Outpost once current sector is safe.'
'Followers get sent for inspection to nearest safe Outpost once their maintenance factor reaches '
'Retreat: if combined enemy strength in sector is X times greater than allied forces'
'Retreat: when spotting this enemy ship class or anything larger'
'checks fleet's needs in missiles, automatically orders them from its homebase, if any.'

line.comment: * add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t

line.text: 'Auto-Rename entire fleet when a follower gets added or removed'
'See Renommage global des vaisseaux menu for expressions. Use *l for the exclusive commander prefix.'
'Hide commander from leader list at top'

line.comment: * $t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='commander will resume previous task after interception.'
* add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t

line.text: 'Do not respond if threat already being handled by other fleets'
'only if other fleet uses exactly the same Ignore... settings.'
'automatically orders new ships until your quotas are met.'

line.comment: * $t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='Multiple templates for the same ship type doesnt work.'
* add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
* add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
* $t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='You can add new templates by using the Template manager from your Personal console.'
* add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t

line.text: 'puts 50% of each ship type into a new fleet with same settings. Auto-Build quotas are not reduced.'
'uses fleet settings of the new commander.'
'Select a fleet commander to edit its settings.'

sval.val: The supplier cannot be in a fleet
All ships are joining the fleet commander.
All ships are docking at homebase.
The fleet commander is now defending
The fleet commander is now defending
Click on a follower to switch its current fleet status.
You have no fleet commander. To promote any ship, see Ship Command Console > Fleet Control.
Commander: Defend homebase sector (no homebase set)
Fleet: Dock at commander's homebase (no homebase set)
(blocks Porte de scan, sector monitoring, repair and inspections)
Followers only. Engage enemy ships in range. 0km to disable.
only recommended if all fleet ships have similar speed (fast ships rush ahead).
Attack order: 1/ Priority target 2/ Porte de scan 3/ Commander's attacker 4/ Commander's target (optional).
Followers always engage station targets regardless of this setting.
Followers get sent to nearest safe Outpost once current sector is safe.
Followers get sent for inspection to nearest safe Outpost once their maintenance factor reaches
Retreat: if combined enemy strength in sector is X times greater than allied forces
Retreat: when spotting this enemy ship class or anything larger
checks fleet's needs in missiles, automatically orders them from its homebase, if any.
Auto-Rename entire fleet when a follower gets added or removed
See Renommage global des vaisseaux menu for expressions. Use *l for the exclusive commander prefix.
Hide commander from leader list at top
Hide all followers from property menu
Show all followers in property menu
Do not respond if threat already being handled by other fleets
only if other fleet uses exactly the same Ignore... settings.
automatically orders new ships until your quotas are met.
puts 50% of each ship type into a new fleet with same settings. Auto-Build quotas are not reduced.
uses fleet settings of the new commander.
Select a fleet commander to edit its settings.
DO NOT USE ARRAYS AS RETURN VALUES. USE TABLES INSTEAD.
NOTE: [DATATYPE_TABLE] is not recognized by X-Studio. Use "if table get size: table = $return" instead.
!ship.cmd.fleet.supply automatically checks if the supplier is needed by at least one fleet, so we don't need to check that here.
ZH 2.0 - selecting a basic ship type without a template is now possible
Mordan4. Remove lag by stripping colors. This submenu is already being colored below when added to the menu, so if we have colors to start with, the system chokes on it a bit.
add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
$t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='commander will resume previous task after interception.'
add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
$t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='Multiple templates for the same ship type doesnt work.'
add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
$t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='You can add new templates by using the Template manager from your Personal console.'
add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
